name: UpdateFactor
description: Update a specific Factor. This endpoint can be used to Verify a Factor if passed an `AuthPayload` param.

ServiceSid.description: The unique SID identifier of the Service.

Identity.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Factor. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

Sid.description: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this Factor.

AuthPayload.description: The optional payload needed to verify the Factor for the first time. E.g. for a TOTP, the numeric code.

Config.CodeLength.description: Number of digits for generated TOTP codes. Must be between 3 and 8, inclusive

Config.NotificationPlatform.description:
The transport technology used to generate the Notification Token. Can be `apn`, `fcm` or `none`.

Required when `factor_type` is `push`.

Config.NotificationToken.description: For APN, the device token. For FCM, the registration token. It is used to send the push notifications. Required when `factor_type` is `push`. If specified, this value must be between 32 and 255 characters long.

Config.SdkVersion.description: The Verify Push SDK version used to configure the factor

Config.Skew.description: The number of time-steps, past and future, that are valid for validation of TOTP codes. Must be between 0 and 2, inclusive

Config.TimeStep.description: Defines how often, in seconds, are TOTP codes generated. i.e, a new TOTP code is generated every time_step seconds. Must be between 20 and 60 seconds, inclusive

FriendlyName.description: The new friendly name of this Factor. It can be up to 64 characters.

$ul: **account_sid**: The unique SID identifier of the Account.
**config**: An object that contains configurations specific to a `factor_type`.
**date_created**: The date that this Factor was created, given in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
**date_updated**: The date that this Factor was updated, given in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
**entity_sid**: The unique SID identifier of the Entity.
**friendly_name**: A human readable description of this resource, up to 64 characters. For a push factor, this can be the device's name.

**identity**: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Factor. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

**metadata**: Custom metadata associated with the factor. This is added by the Device/SDK directly to allow for the inclusion of device information. It must be a stringified JSON with only strings values eg. `{"os": "Android"}`. Can be up to 1024 characters in length.
**service_sid**: The unique SID identifier of the Service.
**sid**: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this Factor.
